details:
# A-RE-PermitSiphon Technical Specification

## System Overview

A-RE-PermitSiphon is an automated permit request extraction and routing system designed to siphon permit data from heterogeneous sources, normalize payloads, and route to downstream approval engines with fault-tolerant guarantees.

---

## Core Logic Block

### 1. Data Flow Architecture

```
┌─────────────────┐     ┌──────────────────┐     ┌─────────────────┐
│  Permit Sources │────▶│  Siphon Engine   │────▶│  Routing Layer  │
│  (n endpoints)  │     │  (normalization) │     │  (k partitions) │
└─────────────────┘     └──────────────────┘     └─────────────────┘
         │                       │                        │
         ▼                       ▼                        ▼
   ┌───────────┐          ┌───────────┐           ┌───────────┐
   │ Rate Limiter│        │ Validator │           │ Dead Letter│
   │ (token bucket)│      │ (schema)  │           │ Queue      │
   └───────────┘          └───────────┘           └───────────┘
```

---

## 2. Breakdown Point Score (BPS) Matrix

### BPS Calculation Formula

```
BPS = Σ(Wᵢ × Sᵢ × Pᵢ) / Σ(Wᵢ)

Where:
  Wᵢ = Weight factor for failure mode i (1-10)
  Sᵢ = Severity coefficient (1.0 - 5.0)
  Pᵢ = Probability of occurrence (0.0 - 1.0)
```

### BPS Risk Matrix

| Failure Mode | Code | Weight (W) | Severity (S) | Probability (P) | BPS Component | Threshold |
|--------------|------|------------|--------------|-----------------|---------------|-----------|
| Source Timeout | FT-001 | 8 | 3.5 | 0.15 | 4.20 | ≤ 5.0 |
| Schema Violation | FV-002 | 9 | 4.0 | 0.08 | 2.88 | ≤ 3.0 |
| Queue Overflow | FQ-003 | 10 | 5.0 | 0.03 | 1.50 | ≤ 2.0 |
| Routing Deadlock | FR-004 | 7 | 4.5 | 0.05 | 1.575 | ≤ 2.0 |
| Auth Token Expiry | FA-005 | 6 | 2.5 | 0.12 | 1.80 | ≤ 2.5 |
| Downstream Rejection | FD-006 | 8 | 3.0 | 0.10 | 2.40 | ≤ 3.0 |
| Data Corruption | FC-007 | 10 | 5.0 | 0.01 | 0.50 | ≤ 1.0 |
| Rate Limit Breach | FR-008 | 5 | 2.0 | 0.20 | 2.00 | ≤ 2.5 |

### Aggregate BPS Calculation

```
Total_BPS = (4.20 + 2.88 + 1.50 + 1.575 + 1.80 + 2.40 + 0.50 + 2.00) / 8
Total_BPS = 16.855 / 8
Total_BPS = 2.107

Critical Threshold: BPS > 3.5 triggers circuit breaker
Warning Threshold: BPS > 2.5 triggers alerting
Nominal Range: BPS ≤ 2.0
```

### BPS State Machine

```
         ┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
         │                                     │
         ▼                                     │
    ┌─────────┐   BPS > 2.5   ┌─────────┐     │
    │ NOMINAL │──────────────▶│ WARNING │     │
    │ (green) │               │ (yellow)│     │
    └─────────┘               └─────────┘     │
         ▲                         │          │
         │                         │ BPS > 3.5│
         │ BPS ≤ 2.0               ▼          │
         │                    ┌─────────┐     │
         │                    │CRITICAL │     │
         └────────────────────│  (red)  │─────┘
              cooldown: 300s  └─────────┘
                              circuit_open
```

---

## 3. Input Validation JSON Schema

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema",
  "$id": "https://sre.internal/schemas/a-re-permit-siphon/v2.1.0",
  "title": "A-RE-PermitSiphon Input Payload",
  "type": "object",
  "required": [
    "permit_id",
    "source_system",
    "timestamp",
    "payload",
    "routing_metadata"
  ],
  "properties": {
    "permit_id": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "^PRM-[A-Z]{2}-[0-9]{8}-[A-F0-9]{6}$",
      "description": "Unique permit identifier: PRM-{region}-{date}-{hash}"
    },
    "source_system": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["system_id", "version", "auth_token_hash"],
      "properties": {
        "system_id": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": ["SYS_ALPHA", "SYS_BETA", "SYS_GAMMA", "SYS_DELTA", "SYS_LEGACY"]
        },
        "version": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "^[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+$"
        },
        "auth_token_hash": {
          "type": "string",
          "minLength": 64,
          "maxLength": 64,
          "pattern": "^[a-f0-9]{64}$"
        }
      }
    },
    "timestamp": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["created_at", "received_at"],
      "properties": {
        "created_at": {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "date-time"
        },
        "received_at": {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "date-time"
        },
        "ttl_seconds": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 60,
          "maximum": 86400,
          "default": 3600
        }
      }
    },
    "payload": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["permit_type", "applicant", "jurisdiction", "data"],
      "properties": {
        "permit_type": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": [
            "CONSTRUCTION",
            "ELECTRICAL",
            "PLUMBING",
            "MECHANICAL",
            "DEMOLITION",
            "OCCUPANCY",
            "SPECIAL_USE"
          ]
        },
        "applicant": {
          "type": "object",
          "required": ["entity_id", "entity_type"],
          "properties": {
            "entity_id": {
              "type": "string",
              "pattern": "^ENT-[0-9]{12}$"
            },
            "entity_type": {
              "type": "string",
              "enum": ["INDIVIDUAL", "CORPORATION", "LLC", "GOVERNMENT", "NONPROFIT"]
            }
          }
        },
        "jurisdiction": {
          "type": "object",
          "required": ["code", "level"],
          "properties": {
            "code": {
              "type": "string",
              "pattern": "^[A-Z]{2}-[A-Z0-9]{3,6}$"
            },
            "level": {
              "type": "string",
              "enum": ["FEDERAL", "STATE", "COUNTY", "MUNICIPAL", "DISTRICT"]
            }
          }
        },
        "data": {
          "type": "object",
          "additionalProperties": true,
          "maxProperties": 100
        },
        "priority": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 1,
          "maximum": 10,
          "default": 5
        }
      }
    },
    "routing_metadata": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["partition_key", "retry_policy"],
      "properties": {
        "partition_key": {
          "type": "string",
          "minLength": 1,
          "maxLength": 256
        },
        "retry_policy": {
          "type": "object",
          "required": ["max_attempts", "backoff_multiplier"],
          "properties": {
            "max_attempts": {
              "type": "integer",
              "minimum": 1,
              "maximum": 10
            },
            "backoff_multiplier": {
              "type": "number",
              "minimum": 1.0,
              "maximum": 5.0
            },
            "initial_delay_ms": {
              "type": "integer",
              "minimum": 100,
              "maximum": 30000,
              "default": 1000
            }
          }
        },
        "dead_letter_config": {
          "type": "object",
          "properties": {
            "enabled": {
              "type": "boolean",
              "default": true
            },
            "queue_arn": {
              "type": "string",
              "pattern": "^arn:aws:sqs:[a-z0-9-]+:[0-9]{12}:[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$"
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "checksum": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["algorithm", "value"],
      "properties": {
        "algorithm": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": ["SHA256", "SHA512", "BLAKE3"]
        },
        "value": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "^[a-f0-9]+$"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "additionalProperties": false
}
```

---

## 4. SRE Operational Metrics

### 4.1 Service Level Indicators (SLIs)

| Metric ID | Metric Name | Calculation | Unit |
|-----------|-------------|-------------|------|
| SLI-001 | Ingestion Latency P50 | `percentile(ingestion_duration_ms, 50)` | ms |
| SLI-002 | Ingestion Latency P99 | `percentile(ingestion_duration_ms, 99)` | ms |
| SLI-003 | Validation Success Rate | `(valid_payloads / total_payloads) × 100` | % |
| SLI-004 | Routing Success Rate | `(routed_success / routed_attempts) × 100` | % |
| SLI-005 | End-to-End Latency P95 | `percentile(e2e_duration_ms, 95)` | ms |
| SLI-006 | Throughput | `count(processed_permits) / interval_seconds` | req/s |
| SLI-007 | Error Rate | `(error_count / total_requests) × 100` | % |
| SLI-008 | Queue Depth | `current_queue_size / max_queue_capacity` | ratio |

### 4.2 Service Level Objectives (SLOs)

```yaml
slo_definitions:
  availability:
    target: 99.95%
    window: 30d
    calculation: |
      (successful_requests / total_requests) >= 0.9995
    error_budget_burn_rate:
      fast: 14.4  # 1h window
      slow: 6.0   # 6h window

  latency_p99:
    target: 500ms
    window: 30d
    calculation: |
      percentile(request_duration_ms, 99) <= 500

  throughput:
    target: 10000 req/s
    window: 1h
    calculation: |
      rate(processed_permits_total[1h]) >= 10000

  data_integrity:
    target: 99.999%
    window: 30d
    calculation: |
      (permits_without_corruption / total_permits) >= 0.99999
```

### 4.3 Operational Metrics Dashboard Queries

```promql
# Ingestion Rate (5m rolling)
rate(permit_siphon_ingested_total[5m])

# Validation Failure Rate
sum(rate(permit_siphon_validation_failures_total[5m])) 
  / sum(rate(permit_siphon_ingested_total[5m])) * 100

# P99 Latency by Source System
histogram_quantile(0.99, 
  sum(rate(permit_siphon_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) 
  by (le, source_system)
)

# Queue Saturation
permit_siphon_queue_current_size 
  / permit_siphon_queue_max_capacity

# Error Budget Remaining
1 - (
  sum(increase(permit_siphon_errors_total[30d])) 
  / sum(increase(permit_siphon_requests_total[30d]))
) / (1 - 0.9995)

# BPS Real-time Calculation
sum(
  permit_siphon_failure_weight 
  * permit_siphon_failure_severity 
  * permit_siphon_failure_probability
) / sum(permit_siphon_failure_weight)

# Circuit Breaker State
permit_siphon_circuit_breaker_state{state="open"}
```

### 4.4 Alerting Rules

```yaml
groups:
  - name: permit_siphon_critical
    rules:
      - alert: PermitSiphonHighErrorRate
        expr: |
          sum(rate(permit_siphon_errors_total[5m])) 
          / sum(rate(permit_siphon_requests_total[5m])) > 0.01
        for: 2m
        labels:
          severity: critical
          team: sre-platform
        annotations:
          summary: "Error rate exceeds 1% threshold"
          runbook: "https://runbooks.internal/permit-siphon/high-error-rate"

      - alert: PermitSiphonBPSCritical
        expr: permit_siphon_bps_score > 3.5
        for: 1m
        labels:
          severity: critical
          team: sre-platform
        annotations:
          summary: "BPS score critical - circuit breaker engaged"

      - alert: PermitSiphonLatencyDegradation
        expr: |
          histogram_quantile(0.99, 
            sum(rate(permit_siphon_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) by (le)
          ) > 0.5
        for: 5m
        labels:
          severity: warning
          team: sre-platform
        annotations:
          summary: "P99 latency exceeds 500ms SLO"

      - alert: PermitSiphonQueueBackpressure
        expr: |
          permit_siphon_queue_current_size 
          / permit_siphon_queue_max_capacity > 0.85
        for: 3m
        labels:
          severity: warning
```

custom_outputs.description: Downstream Intent
The permit data mapped to the internal schema (type, applicant, jurisdiction).
Array of schema violations or "Success" state.
Final destination (e.g., "PARTITION_K", "DEAD_LETTER").
BLAKE3/SHA256 hash of the raw input for provenance.

details:
# A-RE-ValuationBPS Technical Specification

## 1. Core Logic Definition

### 1.1 Breakdown Point Score (BPS) Formula

```
BPS = Σ(Wᵢ × Rᵢ × Sᵢ) / N

Where:
  Wᵢ = Weight factor for risk category i (0.0 - 1.0)
  Rᵢ = Risk probability coefficient (0.0 - 1.0)
  Sᵢ = Severity multiplier (1 - 10)
  N  = Normalization constant = Σ(Wᵢ × 10)
```

### 1.2 Valuation Decay Function

```
V(t) = V₀ × e^(-λ × BPS × t)

Where:
  V(t) = Asset value at time t
  V₀   = Initial asset valuation
  λ    = Decay constant (default: 0.023)
  BPS  = Breakdown Point Score (0.0 - 1.0)
  t    = Time in operational cycles
```

### 1.3 Operational Threshold Boundaries

```
BPS_critical = 0.75
BPS_warning  = 0.50
BPS_nominal  = 0.25

State Machine:
  IF BPS ≥ BPS_critical THEN state = CRITICAL
  ELSE IF BPS ≥ BPS_warning THEN state = DEGRADED
  ELSE IF BPS ≥ BPS_nominal THEN state = NOMINAL
  ELSE state = OPTIMAL
```

---

## 2. BPS Risk Matrix

### 2.1 Operational Failure Risk Categories

| Category ID | Risk Domain | Weight (Wᵢ) | Failure Mode | MTTR Target |
|-------------|-------------|-------------|--------------|-------------|
| RF-001 | Infrastructure Availability | 0.95 | Complete outage | ≤ 15 min |
| RF-002 | Data Integrity | 0.90 | Corruption/Loss | ≤ 30 min |
| RF-003 | Performance Degradation | 0.75 | Latency > P99 SLO | ≤ 10 min |
| RF-004 | Security Breach | 0.98 | Unauthorized access | ≤ 5 min |
| RF-005 | Dependency Failure | 0.70 | Upstream/downstream | ≤ 20 min |
| RF-006 | Configuration Drift | 0.60 | State mismatch | ≤ 45 min |
| RF-007 | Capacity Exhaustion | 0.80 | Resource saturation | ≤ 25 min |
| RF-008 | Observability Gap | 0.55 | Blind spot detection | ≤ 60 min |

### 2.2 Severity Multiplier Matrix

| Severity Level | Sᵢ Value | Impact Scope | Revenue Impact |
|----------------|----------|--------------|----------------|
| S1 - Catastrophic | 10 | Full system | > $1M/hour |
| S2 - Critical | 8 | Multi-region | $500K-$1M/hour |
| S3 - Major | 6 | Single region | $100K-$500K/hour |
| S4 - Moderate | 4 | Service cluster | $10K-$100K/hour |
| S5 - Minor | 2 | Single instance | < $10K/hour |
| S6 - Negligible | 1 | No user impact | $0 |

### 2.3 Risk Probability Coefficients

```
Rᵢ = (incident_count_30d / operational_hours_30d) × availability_inverse

availability_inverse = 1 / (1 - downtime_ratio)

Probability Bands:
  R ∈ [0.00, 0.10] → LOW
  R ∈ [0.11, 0.35] → MODERATE  
  R ∈ [0.36, 0.60] → HIGH
  R ∈ [0.61, 1.00] → CRITICAL
```

---

## 3. JSON Schema Specification

### 3.1 Input Validation Schema

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema",
  "$id": "https://sre.internal/schemas/a-re-valuation-bps/v1",
  "title": "A-RE-ValuationBPS Input Schema",
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["asset_id", "valuation_context", "risk_factors", "temporal_params"],
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "asset_id": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "^ARE-[A-Z]{2}-[0-9]{8}$",
      "description": "Unique asset identifier"
    },
    "valuation_context": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["initial_value", "currency", "valuation_date"],
      "properties": {
        "initial_value": {
          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0,
          "maximum": 1e15,
          "description": "V₀ in valuation formula"
        },
        "currency": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": ["USD", "EUR", "GBP", "JPY"],
          "default": "USD"
        },
        "valuation_date": {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "date-time"
        },
        "decay_constant": {
          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0.001,
          "maximum": 0.999,
          "default": 0.023,
          "description": "λ decay constant"
        }
      }
    },
    "risk_factors": {
      "type": "array",
      "minItems": 1,
      "maxItems": 50,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "required": ["category_id", "weight", "probability", "severity"],
        "properties": {
          "category_id": {
            "type": "string",
            "pattern": "^RF-[0-9]{3}$"
          },
          "weight": {
            "type": "number",
            "minimum": 0.0,
            "maximum": 1.0
          },
          "probability": {
            "type": "number",
            "minimum": 0.0,
            "maximum": 1.0
          },
          "severity": {
            "type": "integer",
            "minimum": 1,
            "maximum": 10
          },
          "incident_metadata": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
              "count_30d": {
                "type": "integer",
                "minimum": 0
              },
              "mttr_seconds": {
                "type": "integer",
                "minimum": 0
              },
              "last_occurrence": {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "date-time"
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "temporal_params": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["projection_cycles", "cycle_unit"],
      "properties": {
        "projection_cycles": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 1,
          "maximum": 365
        },
        "cycle_unit": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": ["HOUR", "DAY", "WEEK", "MONTH"]
        },
        "evaluation_window_hours": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 1,
          "maximum": 8760,
          "default": 720
        }
      }
    },
    "slo_targets": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "availability_target": {
          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0.9,
          "maximum": 0.99999
        },
        "latency_p99_ms": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 1,
          "maximum": 30000
        },
        "error_budget_remaining": {
          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0.0,
          "maximum": 1.0
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### 3.2 Output Schema

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema",
  "$id": "https://sre.internal/schemas/a-re-valuation-bps/v1/output",
  "title": "A-RE-ValuationBPS Output Schema",
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["asset_id", "bps_score", "valuation_projection", "operational_state", "computed_at"],
  "properties": {
    "asset_id": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "bps_score": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "composite": {
          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0.0,
          "maximum": 1.0
        },
        "category_breakdown": {
          "type": "array",
          "items": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
              "category_id": { "type": "string" },
              "contribution": { "type": "number" }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "valuation_projection": {
      "type": "array",
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "properties": {
          "cycle": { "type": "integer" },
          "projected_value": { "type": "number" },
          "decay_rate": { "type": "number" }
        }
      }
    },
    "operational_state": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": ["OPTIMAL", "NOMINAL", "DEGRADED", "CRITICAL"]
    },
    "computed_at": {
      "type": "string",
      "format": "date-time"
    }
  }
}
```

---

## 4. SRE Metrics Specification

### 4.1 Golden Signals Mapping

| Signal | Metric Name | Unit | Collection Interval | Aggregation |
|--------|-------------|------|---------------------|-------------|
| Latency | `are_bps_computation_duration_seconds` | seconds | 10s | histogram |
| Traffic | `are_bps_evaluations_total` | count | 10s | counter |
| Errors | `are_bps_validation_failures_total` | count | 10s | counter |
| Saturation | `are_bps_queue_depth` | count | 10s | gauge |

### 4.2 SLI Definitions

```yaml
sli_specifications:
  availability:
    metric: |
      sum(rate(are_bps_requests_success_total[5m])) /
      sum(rate(are_bps_requests_total[5m]))
    target: 0.999
    
  latency_p99:
    metric: |
      histogram_quantile(0.99, 
        sum(rate(are_bps_computation_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) by (le))
    target_ms: 500
    
  correctness:
    metric: |
      1 - (sum(rate(are_bps_calculation_errors_total[5m])) /
           sum(rate(are_bps_evaluations_total[5m])))
    target: 0.9999
```

### 4.3 Error Budget Calculation

```
Error Budget (monthly) = (1 - SLO_target) × total_minutes_in_month

For 99.9% availability:
  EB = (1 - 0.999) × 43200 = 43.2 minutes/month

Burn Rate:
  burn_rate = (error_rate_current / error_rate_budget) × time_window

Alert Thresholds:
  burn_rate > 14.4  → PAGE (2% budget in 1 hour)
  burn_rate > 6.0   → PAGE (5% budget in 6 hours)
  burn_rate > 1.0   → TICKET (10% budget in 3 days)
```

### 4.4 Operational Success Metrics

| Metric | Formula | Target | Alert Threshold |
|--------|---------|--------|-----------------|
| MTTR | `avg(incident_resolution_time)` | ≤ 30 min | > 45 min |
| MTTD | `avg(detection_time - incident_start)` | ≤ 5 min | > 10 min |
| Change Failure Rate | `failed_changes / total_changes` | ≤ 15% | > 25% |
| BPS Accuracy | `1 - abs(predicted_bps - actual_bps) / actual_bps` | ≥ 95% | < 90% |
| Valuation Drift | `abs(V_projected - V_actual) / V_actual` | ≤ 5% | > 10% |

### 4.5 Prometheus Recording Rules

```yaml
groups:
  - name: are_bps_recording_rules
    interval: 30s
    rules:
      - record: are:bps:composite_score
        expr: |
          sum by (asset_id) (
            are_bps_risk_weight * 
            are_bps_risk_probability * 
            are_bps_risk_severity
          ) / 
          sum by (asset_id) (are_bps_risk_weight * 10)
          
      - record: are:valuation:decay_rate
        expr: |
          are_valuation_initial * 
          exp(-0.023 * are:bps:composite_score * are_operational_cycles)
          
      - record: are:slo:error_budget_remaining
        expr: |
          1 - (
            sum(increase(are_bps_errors_total[30d])) /
            (sum(increase(are_bps_requests_total[30d])) * 0.001)
          )
```

### 4.6 Alerting Rules

```yaml
groups:
  - name: are_bps_alerts
    rules:
      - alert: AREBPSCriticalThreshold
        expr: are:bps:composite_score > 0.75
        for: 5m
        labels:
          severity: critical
        annotations:
          summary: "Asset {{ $labels.asset_id }} BPS exceeds critical threshold"
          
      - alert: AREValuationRapidDecay
        expr: |
          (are_valuation_current / are_valuation_initial) < 0.5 
          AND rate(are_valuation_current[1h]) < -0.01
        for: 15m
        labels:
          severity: warning
          
      - alert: AREBPSCalculationLatency
        expr: |
          histogram_quantile(0.99, 
            rate(are_bps_computation_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) > 0.5
        for: 10m
        labels:
          severity: warning
```

---

## 5. Computation Pipeline Logic

### 5.1 Processing Sequence

```
┌─────────────────┐
│  Input Ingress  │
│  (JSON Payload) │
└────────┬────────┘
         │
         ▼
┌─────────────────┐
│ Schema Validate │──── FAIL ───▶ [Error: VALIDATION_FAILED]
│  (JSON Schema)  │
└────────┬────────┘
         │ PASS
         ▼
┌─────────────────┐
│  Risk Factor    │
│  Normalization  │
│  Wᵢ, Rᵢ, Sᵢ     │
└────────┬────────┘
         │
         ▼
┌─────────────────
```

"NORMAL", "WARNING", or "CRITICAL_HALT".

# A-HR-OutcomeExtract Technical Specification

## System Overview

A-HR-OutcomeExtract is an automated pipeline for extracting, validating, and scoring HR outcome data from heterogeneous source systems with deterministic failure handling.

---

## Core Logic Block

### 1. Input Validation JSON Schema

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema",
  "$id": "a-hr-outcome-extract-input-v1",
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["extraction_id", "source_system", "timestamp", "payload"],
  "properties": {
    "extraction_id": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "^EXT-[A-Z]{2}-[0-9]{8}-[A-F0-9]{12}$"
    },
    "source_system": {
      "type": "string",
      "enum": ["WORKDAY", "SAP_HCM", "ORACLE_HCM", "ADP", "CUSTOM_HRIS"]
    },
    "timestamp": {
      "type": "string",
      "format": "date-time"
    },
    "payload": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["employee_records", "outcome_type", "period"],
      "properties": {
        "employee_records": {
          "type": "array",
          "minItems": 1,
          "maxItems": 100000,
          "items": {
            "$ref": "#/$defs/employee_outcome"
          }
        },
        "outcome_type": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": ["PERFORMANCE", "COMPENSATION", "TERMINATION", "PROMOTION", "TRANSFER", "ONBOARDING"]
        },
        "period": {
          "type": "object",
          "required": ["start", "end"],
          "properties": {
            "start": {"type": "string", "format": "date"},
            "end": {"type": "string", "format": "date"}
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "metadata": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "retry_count": {"type": "integer", "minimum": 0, "maximum": 5},
        "priority": {"type": "integer", "minimum": 1, "maximum": 10},
        "checksum": {"type": "string", "pattern": "^[a-f0-9]{64}$"}
      }
    }
  },
  "$defs": {
    "employee_outcome": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["employee_id", "outcome_value", "effective_date"],
      "properties": {
        "employee_id": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "^EMP[0-9]{9}$"
        },
        "outcome_value": {
          "oneOf": [
            {"type": "number"},
            {"type": "string", "maxLength": 500},
            {"type": "object"}
          ]
        },
        "effective_date": {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "date"
        },
        "confidence_score": {
          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0.0,
          "maximum": 1.0
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

---

### 2. Breakdown Point Score (BPS) Matrix

#### 2.1 BPS Calculation Formula

```
BPS = Σ(Wi × Fi × Si) / N

Where:
  Wi = Weight factor for failure category i (0.1 - 1.0)
  Fi = Frequency coefficient (occurrences per 10,000 operations)
  Si = Severity multiplier (1 = low, 5 = critical)
  N  = Normalization constant (sum of all weights)
```

#### 2.2 Operational Failure Risk Matrix

| Failure Category | Code | Weight (Wi) | Base Frequency (Fi) | Severity (Si) | BPS Contribution | Threshold |
|-----------------|------|-------------|---------------------|---------------|------------------|-----------|
| Schema Validation Failure | SVF-001 | 0.85 | 12.5 | 3 | 31.875 | ≤ 50 |
| Source Connection Timeout | SCT-002 | 0.95 | 8.2 | 4 | 31.16 | ≤ 40 |
| Data Integrity Violation | DIV-003 | 1.00 | 3.1 | 5 | 15.50 | ≤ 20 |
| Transformation Logic Error | TLE-004 | 0.90 | 5.7 | 4 | 20.52 | ≤ 30 |
| Downstream Write Failure | DWF-005 | 0.80 | 2.3 | 5 | 9.20 | ≤ 15 |
| Authentication Expiry | AEX-006 | 0.70 | 15.8 | 2 | 22.12 | ≤ 35 |
| Rate Limit Exceeded | RLE-007 | 0.60 | 22.4 | 2 | 26.88 | ≤ 40 |
| Memory Exhaustion | MEX-008 | 0.95 | 1.2 | 5 | 5.70 | ≤ 10 |
| Checksum Mismatch | CSM-009 | 1.00 | 0.8 | 5 | 4.00 | ≤ 5 |
| Partial Extraction | PEX-010 | 0.75 | 6.9 | 3 | 15.525 | ≤ 25 |

#### 2.3 Aggregate BPS Scoring

```
Total_BPS = Σ(BPS_i) for all active failure categories

Risk Classification:
  0-50:    NOMINAL      (Green)
  51-100:  ELEVATED     (Yellow)
  101-150: DEGRADED     (Orange)
  151-200: CRITICAL     (Red)
  >200:    BREAKDOWN    (Black) → Circuit breaker activation
```

#### 2.4 BPS Decay Function

```python
def calculate_bps_decay(initial_bps: float, time_since_incident_hours: float) -> float:
    """
    Exponential decay of BPS contribution over time
    Half-life: 24 hours for non-critical, 72 hours for critical
    """
    lambda_decay = 0.693 / (72 if initial_bps > 15 else 24)
    return initial_bps * math.exp(-lambda_decay * time_since_incident_hours)
```

---

### 3. Extraction Logic State Machine

```
┌─────────────┐
│   IDLE      │
└──────┬──────┘
       │ trigger_extraction()
       ▼
┌─────────────┐     validation_failed
│  VALIDATING │────────────────────────┐
└──────┬──────┘                        │
       │ schema_valid                  │
       ▼                               ▼
┌─────────────┐                 ┌─────────────┐
│ CONNECTING  │                 │  REJECTED   │
└──────┬──────┘                 └─────────────┘
       │ connection_established
       ▼
┌─────────────┐     extraction_error
│ EXTRACTING  │────────────────────────┐
└──────┬──────┘                        │
       │ data_received                 │
       ▼                               ▼
┌─────────────┐                 ┌─────────────┐
│ TRANSFORMING│                 │   FAILED    │
└──────┬──────┘                 └──────┬──────┘
       │ transform_complete            │ retry_eligible
       ▼                               ▼
┌─────────────┐                 ┌─────────────┐
│  LOADING    │                 │  RETRYING   │──┐
└──────┬──────┘                 └─────────────┘  │
       │ load_complete                 ▲         │
       ▼                               └─────────┘
┌─────────────┐
│  COMPLETE   │
└─────────────┘
```

---

### 4. SRE Metrics Specification

#### 4.1 Service Level Indicators (SLIs)

| Metric Name | Type | Formula | Unit |
|-------------|------|---------|------|
| `extraction_latency_p50` | Latency | percentile(extraction_duration, 0.50) | ms |
| `extraction_latency_p95` | Latency | percentile(extraction_duration, 0.95) | ms |
| `extraction_latency_p99` | Latency | percentile(extraction_duration, 0.99) | ms |
| `extraction_success_rate` | Availability | successful_extractions / total_extractions | ratio |
| `record_throughput` | Throughput | records_processed / time_window | records/s |
| `data_freshness` | Freshness | now() - max(record_timestamp) | seconds |
| `validation_pass_rate` | Quality | valid_records / total_records | ratio |
| `error_budget_remaining` | Budget | 1 - (errors / allowed_errors) | ratio |

#### 4.2 Service Level Objectives (SLOs)

```yaml
slos:
  availability:
    target: 99.95
    window: 30d
    burn_rate_alerts:
      - severity: critical
        burn_rate: 14.4
        window: 1h
      - severity: warning
        burn_rate: 6.0
        window: 6h
        
  latency:
    p50_target_ms: 500
    p95_target_ms: 2000
    p99_target_ms: 5000
    
  throughput:
    minimum_records_per_second: 1000
    burst_capacity_multiplier: 3.0
    
  data_quality:
    validation_pass_rate: 99.9
    checksum_match_rate: 100.0
    
  freshness:
    max_staleness_seconds: 300
    alerting_threshold_seconds: 180
```

          ) > 5
        for: 10m

---

### 5. Circuit Breaker Logic

```python
class CircuitBreaker:
    CLOSED = "CLOSED"
    OPEN = "OPEN"
    HALF_OPEN = "HALF_OPEN"
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.state = self.CLOSED
        self.failure_count = 0
        self.success_count = 0
        self.last_failure_time = None
        
        # Thresholds
        self.failure_threshold = 5
        self.success_threshold = 3
        self.timeout_seconds = 60
        self.bps_threshold = 200
        
    def evaluate(self, bps_score: float, operation_result: bool) -> str:
        if bps_score > self.bps_threshold:
            self._trip()
            return self.OPEN
            
        if self.state == self.CLOSED:
            if not operation_result:
                self.failure_count += 1
                if self.failure_count >= self.failure_threshold:
                    self._trip()
            else:
                self.failure_count = 0
                
        elif self.state == self.OPEN:
            if self._timeout_elapsed():
                self.state = self.HALF_OPEN
                self.success_count = 0
                
        elif self.state == self.HALF_OPEN:
            if operation_result:
                self.success_count += 1
                if self.success_count >= self.success_threshold:
                    self._reset()
            else:
                self._trip()
                
        return self.state
        
    def _trip(self):
        self.state = self.OPEN
        self.last_failure_time = time.time()
        self.failure_count = 0
        
    def _reset(self):
        self.state = self.CLOSED
        self.failure_count = 0
        self.
```

# A-PA-ModelAlign Technical Specification

## 1. Core Logic Definition

### 1.1 Alignment Function

```
A-PA-ModelAlign := f(M, P, A) → S

Where:
  M = Model behavior vector ∈ ℝⁿ
  P = Policy constraint matrix ∈ ℝᵐˣⁿ
  A = Alignment target tensor ∈ ℝᵏˣᵐˣⁿ
  S = Alignment score ∈ [0, 1]
```

### 1.2 Alignment Score Computation

```
S = Σᵢ₌₁ᵏ (wᵢ · σ(Aᵢ · P · Mᵀ)) / Σᵢ₌₁ᵏ wᵢ

Where:
  wᵢ = weight coefficient for alignment dimension i
  σ = sigmoid normalization function
  k = number of alignment dimensions
```

### 1.3 Divergence Detection

```
D(t) = ||M(t) - M(t-1)||₂ / ||M(t-1)||₂

Drift Alert Condition: D(t) > θ_drift
Where θ_drift = 0.05 (5% deviation threshold)
```

---

## 2. Breakdown Point Score (BPS) Matrix

### 2.1 BPS Calculation Formula

```
BPS(c) = (1 - R(c)) × I(c) × P(c)

Where:
  c = component identifier
  R(c) = resilience factor ∈ [0, 1]
  I(c) = impact severity ∈ [1, 10]
  P(c) = probability of failure ∈ [0, 1]

Risk Classification:
  BPS ∈ [0, 2)    → LOW
  BPS ∈ [2, 5)    → MEDIUM
  BPS ∈ [5, 7)    → HIGH
  BPS ∈ [7, 10]   → CRITICAL
```

### 2.2 Component BPS Matrix

| Component ID | Component Name | R(c) | I(c) | P(c) | BPS | Risk Level |
|--------------|----------------|------|------|------|-----|------------|
| C-001 | Input Validator | 0.92 | 8 | 0.03 | 0.019 | LOW |
| C-002 | Policy Engine | 0.85 | 9 | 0.08 | 1.08 | LOW |
| C-003 | Alignment Scorer | 0.78 | 10 | 0.12 | 2.64 | MEDIUM |
| C-004 | Drift Detector | 0.88 | 7 | 0.06 | 0.504 | LOW |
| C-005 | Feedback Loop | 0.72 | 8 | 0.15 | 3.36 | MEDIUM |
| C-006 | Model State Cache | 0.65 | 9 | 0.18 | 5.67 | HIGH |
| C-007 | Constraint Resolver | 0.70 | 10 | 0.22 | 6.60 | HIGH |
| C-008 | Output Sanitizer | 0.90 | 8 | 0.04 | 0.32 | LOW |
| C-009 | Audit Logger | 0.95 | 6 | 0.02 | 0.06 | LOW |
| C-010 | Failover Controller | 0.60 | 10 | 0.25 | 10.0 | CRITICAL |

### 2.3 Aggregate System BPS

```
BPS_system = max(BPS(cᵢ)) × (1 + 0.1 × count(BPS(cᵢ) > 5))

Current: BPS_system = 10.0 × (1 + 0.1 × 3) = 13.0

System Status: CRITICAL - Immediate remediation required
```

---

## 3. Input Validation JSON Schema

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema",
  "$id": "https://sre.internal/schemas/a-pa-modelalign/v1.0.0",
  "title": "A-PA-ModelAlign Input Schema",
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["request_id", "timestamp", "model_state", "policy_set", "alignment_config"],
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "request_id": {
      "type": "string",

    },
    "timestamp": {

    },
    "model_state": {

          }

        }
      }
    },
    "policy_set": {

        },

          }

    "alignment_config": {

              },
              "weight": {
                "type": "number",
                "minimum": 0,
                "maximum": 1
              },
              "target_range": {
                "type": "object",
                "required": ["min", "max"],
                "properties": {
                  "min": { "type": "number", "minimum": 0, "maximum": 1 },
                  "max": { "type": "number", "minimum": 0, "maximum": 1 }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        },

          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0.001,
          "maximum": 0.1
        },

          "type": "integer",

        }
      }
    },

      "type": "object",

          "type": "string",
          "maxLength": 128
        },

          "pattern": "^[a-f0-9]{32}$"
        },
        "trace_context": {
          "type": "object",
          "properties": {
            "trace_id": { "type": "string", "pattern": "^[a-f0-9]{32}$" },
            "span_id": { "type": "string", "pattern": "^[a-f0-9]{16}$" },
            "parent_span_id": { "type": "string", "pattern": "^[a-f0-9]{16}$" }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

---

## 4. SRE Operational Metrics

### 4.1 Service Level Objectives (SLOs)

| Metric ID | Metric Name | Target | Warning | Critical | Measurement Window |
|-----------|-------------|--------|---------|----------|-------------------|
| SLO-001 | Alignment Accuracy | ≥ 99.5% | < 99.5% | < 98.0% | 30-day rolling |
| SLO-002 | Request Latency P50 | ≤ 50ms | > 50ms | > 100ms | 5-minute |
| SLO-003 | Request Latency P99 | ≤ 200ms | > 200ms | > 500ms | 5-minute |
| SLO-004 | Availability | ≥ 99.95% | < 99.95% | < 99.5% | 30-day rolling |
| SLO-005 | Error Rate | ≤ 0.1% | > 0.1% | > 1.0% | 15-minute |
| SLO-006 | Drift Detection Latency | ≤ 5s | > 5s | > 30s | Real-time |
| SLO-007 | Policy Sync Freshness | ≤ 60s | > 60s | > 300s | Continuous |

### 4.2 Service Level Indicators (SLIs)

```
SLI_availability = (total_requests - failed_requests) / total_requests

SLI_latency_p99 = percentile(request_duration, 99)

SLI_alignment_accuracy = count(S ≥ θ_target) / count(total_evaluations)
  Where θ_target = 0.85

SLI_error_rate = count(status_code ∈ [500, 599]) / count(total_requests)

SLI_drift_detection = time(drift_detected) - time(drift_occurred)
```

### 4.3 Error Budget Calculation

```
Error Budget (monthly) = 1 - SLO_target

For SLO-004 (99.95% availability):
  Error Budget = 1 - 0.9995 = 0.0005
  Monthly Downtime Allowed = 0.0005 × 43200 min = 21.6 minutes

Burn Rate = (1 - SLI_current) / (1 - SLO_target)

Alert Thresholds:
  Burn Rate > 14.4  → Page (1-hour budget consumption)
  Burn Rate > 6.0   → Page (6-hour budget consumption)
  Burn Rate > 1.0   → Ticket (budget depletion trajectory)
```

### 4.4 Operational Metrics Dashboard Queries

```promql
# Alignment Score Distribution
histogram_quantile(0.95, 
  sum(rate(modelalign_score_bucket[5m])) by (le, dimension)
)

# Request Error Rate
sum(rate(modelalign_requests_total{status="error"}[5m])) 
/ sum(rate(modelalign_requests_total[5m]))

# Policy Constraint Violations
sum by (constraint_type, enforcement) (
  increase(modelalign_constraint_violations_total[1h])
)

# Drift Detection Events
sum(increase(modelalign_drift_detected_total[24h])) by (severity)

# Component Health Score
1 - (
  sum(modelalign_component_failures_total) 
  / sum(modelalign_component_checks_total)
)
```

### 4.5 Alerting Rules

```yaml
groups:
  - name: a-pa-modelalign-critical
    rules:
      - alert: AlignmentScoreDegradation
        expr: avg(modelalign_score) < 0.80
        for: 5m
        labels:
          severity: critical
        annotations:
          summary: "Alignment score below critical threshold"
          
      - alert: HighErrorBurnRate
        expr: |
          (
            sum(rate(modelalign_requests_total{status="error"}[1h]))
            / sum(rate(modelalign_requests_total[1h]))
          ) / 0.001 > 14.4
        for: 2m
        labels:
          severity: critical
          
      - alert: DriftDetectionFailure
        expr: |
          time() - modelalign_last_drift_check_timestamp > 300
        for: 1m
        labels:
          severity: critical
          
      - alert: PolicySyncStale
        expr: |
          time() - modelalign_policy_last_sync_timestamp > 300
        for: 1m
        labels:
          severity: high
```

---

## 5. State Machine Logic

```
States: {INIT, VALIDATING, ALIGNING, SCORING, ADJUSTING, COMPLETE, FAILED}

Transitions:
  INIT → VALIDATING         : on(request_received)
  VALIDATING → ALIGNING     : on(validation_passed)
  VALIDATING → FAILED       : on(validation_failed)
  ALIGNING → SCORING        : on(alignment_computed)
  ALIGNING → FAILED         : on(timeout | constraint_violation)
  SCORING → ADJUSTING       : on(score < θ_target ∧ iterations < limit)
  SCORING → COMPLETE        : on(score ≥ θ_target)
  SCORING → FAILED          : on(iterations ≥ limit ∧ score < θ_min)
  ADJUSTING → ALIGNING      : on(adjustment_applied)
  ADJUSTING → FAILED        : on(adjustment_rejected)
  FAILED → INIT             : on(retry ∧ retry_count < max_retries)

Invariants:
  ∀ state ∈ States: timeout(state) ≤ 30s
  ∀ transition: log(transition
```]]]

- **Confidence_Threshold**: 0.85

# A-PA-ForgedID Technical Logic Specification

## 1. System Definition

**A-PA-ForgedID**: Authentication Pathway Analyzer for Forged Identity Detection

### 1.1 Core Detection Logic

```
ForgedID_Score = Σ(Wi × Ai) / Σ(Wi)

Where:
- Wi = Weight factor for attribute i
- Ai = Anomaly score for attribute i ∈ [0, 1]
- Detection threshold θ = 0.73
```

### 1.2 Attribute Vector Components

| Attribute ID | Description | Weight (Wi) | Detection Method |
|--------------|-------------|-------------|------------------|
| A01 | Token signature deviation | 0.95 | HMAC-SHA256 validation |
| A02 | Temporal claim drift | 0.88 | NTP sync delta analysis |
| A03 | Issuer chain integrity | 0.92 | X.509 path validation |
| A04 | Behavioral fingerprint | 0.76 | ML classifier output |
| A05 | Geographic impossibility | 0.84 | Velocity check algorithm |
| A06 | Session binding violation | 0.91 | CSRF token correlation |
| A07 | Credential age anomaly | 0.67 | Issuance timestamp analysis |
| A08 | Multi-factor bypass pattern | 0.97 | MFA state machine audit |

---

## 2. Breakdown Point Score (BPS) Matrix

### 2.1 BPS Calculation Formula

```
BPS(component) = (P_failure × I_severity × D_detection) / R_recovery

Where:
- P_failure = Probability of failure [0, 1]
- I_severity = Impact severity [1-10]
- D_detection = Detection difficulty [1-10]  
- R_recovery = Recovery capability [1-10]

Risk Classification:
- BPS < 2.0  → LOW
- BPS 2.0-5.0 → MEDIUM
- BPS 5.0-8.0 → HIGH
- BPS > 8.0  → CRITICAL
```

### 2.2 Component BPS Matrix

| Component | P_failure | I_severity | D_detection | R_recovery | BPS | Risk Level |
|-----------|-----------|------------|-------------|------------|-----|------------|
| Token Validator | 0.02 | 9 | 3 | 7 | 0.077 | LOW |
| Signature Engine | 0.01 | 10 | 2 | 8 | 0.025 | LOW |
| Session Store (Redis) | 0.08 | 8 | 4 | 6 | 0.427 | LOW |
| ML Inference Pipeline | 0.15 | 6 | 7 | 4 | 1.575 | LOW |
| Certificate Authority Link | 0.05 | 10 | 5 | 3 | 0.833 | LOW |
| Geo-IP Resolution | 0.12 | 5 | 6 | 8 | 0.450 | LOW |
| MFA State Machine | 0.03 | 10 | 8 | 5 | 0.480 | LOW |
| Audit Log Pipeline | 0.07 | 7 | 9 | 6 | 0.735 | LOW |
| Rate Limiter | 0.04 | 8 | 3 | 9 | 0.107 | LOW |
| Database Connection Pool | 0.06 | 9 | 4 | 4 | 0.540 | LOW |
| External IdP Federation | 0.18 | 8 | 6 | 3 | 2.880 | MEDIUM |
| Key Management Service | 0.02 | 10 | 9 | 2 | 0.900 | LOW |
| Network Egress Filter | 0.09 | 7 | 8 | 5 | 1.008 | LOW |
| Cascading Auth Failure | 0.11 | 10 | 7 | 2 | 3.850 | MEDIUM |
| Cold Start Latency Spike | 0.22 | 4 | 2 | 9 | 0.196 | LOW |

### 2.3 Aggregate System BPS

```
System_BPS = √(Σ(BPSi²) / n) = √(14.083 / 15) = 0.969

System Risk Classification: LOW-MEDIUM boundary
Critical Path BPS: max(BPS_critical_path) = 3.850
```

details:
# A-CS-TruthDistill Technical Specification

## 1. Core Logic Definition

### 1.1 Truth Distillation Function

```
TruthDistill(S) = argmax_T [ P(T|S) × C(T) × V(T) ]

Where:
  S = Source signal set {s₁, s₂, ..., sₙ}
  T = Truth candidate
  P(T|S) = Posterior probability of T given S
  C(T) = Coherence score across sources
  V(T) = Verification weight
```

### 1.2 Coherence Calculation

```
C(T) = 1 - (σ(S_T) / μ(S_T))

Where:
  S_T = Subset of sources supporting T
  σ = Standard deviation of confidence scores
  μ = Mean confidence score
  
Constraint: C(T) ∈ [0, 1]
```

### 1.3 Verification Weight Matrix

```
V(T) = Σᵢ (wᵢ × vᵢ) / Σᵢ wᵢ

Verification Factors:
  v₁ = Primary source corroboration [w₁ = 0.35]
  v₂ = Temporal consistency [w₂ = 0.25]
  v₃ = Logical entailment validity [w₃ = 0.20]
  v₄ = Cross-domain alignment [w₄ = 0.15]
  v₅ = Adversarial resistance [w₅ = 0.05]
```

---

## 2. Breakdown Point Score (BPS) Matrix

### 2.1 Risk Classification

| Risk ID | Failure Mode | BPS Threshold | Severity | MTTR Target |
|---------|--------------|---------------|----------|-------------|
| BPS-001 | Source Poisoning | 0.15 | CRITICAL | ≤ 5 min |
| BPS-002 | Coherence Collapse | 0.25 | HIGH | ≤ 15 min |
| BPS-003 | Verification Bypass | 0.10 | CRITICAL | ≤ 3 min |
| BPS-004 | Confidence Inflation | 0.30 | MEDIUM | ≤ 30 min |
| BPS-005 | Temporal Drift | 0.40 | LOW | ≤ 60 min |
| BPS-006 | Cascade Propagation | 0.08 | CRITICAL | ≤ 2 min |
| BPS-007 | Schema Violation | 0.20 | HIGH | ≤ 10 min |
| BPS-008 | Quorum Loss | 0.33 | HIGH | ≤ 20 min |

### 2.2 BPS Calculation Formula

```
BPS(failure_mode) = (1 - R(t)) × I × (1 / D)

Where:
  R(t) = Reliability function at time t
  I = Impact coefficient [1-10]
  D = Detection latency (seconds)
  
Critical Threshold: BPS ≥ 0.7 triggers automatic circuit breaker
```

### 2.3 Composite System BPS

```
BPS_system = 1 - Πᵢ(1 - BPSᵢ × Pᵢ)

Where:
  BPSᵢ = Individual component BPS
  Pᵢ = Probability of failure mode i occurring
  
Operational Limit: BPS_system < 0.15
```

---

## 3. JSON Schema for Input Validation

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema",
  "$id": "https://sre.internal/schemas/a-cs-truthdistill/v1",
  "title": "A-CS-TruthDistill Input Schema",
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["request_id", "sources", "distillation_params", "metadata"],
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "request_id": {
      "type": "string",
      "pattern": "^TD-[0-9]{8}-[A-F0-9]{12}$",
      "description": "Unique request identifier"
    },
    "sources": {
      "type": "array",
      "minItems": 2,
      "maxItems": 256,
      "items": {
        "type": "object",
        "required": ["source_id", "content", "confidence", "timestamp"],
        "properties": {
          "source_id": {
            "type": "string",
            "pattern": "^SRC-[A-Z0-9]{8}$"
          },
          "content": {
            "type": "string",
            "minLength": 1,
            "maxLength": 65536
          },
          "confidence": {
            "type": "number",
            "minimum": 0.0,
            "maximum": 1.0,
            "multipleOf": 0.001
          },
          "timestamp": {
            "type": "string",
            "format": "date-time"
          },
          "provenance": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
              "origin": { "type": "string", "maxLength": 256 },
              "chain_hash": { 
                "type": "string", 
                "pattern": "^[a-f0-9]{64}$" 
              },
              "verification_level": {
                "type": "integer",
                "minimum": 0,
                "maximum": 5
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "distillation_params": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["mode", "threshold", "quorum"],
      "properties": {
        "mode": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": ["strict", "balanced", "permissive"]
        },
        "threshold": {
          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0.5,
          "maximum": 0.99
        },
        "quorum": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 2,
          "maximum": 128
        },
        "temporal_window_ms": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 100,
          "maximum": 86400000,
          "default": 300000
        },
        "conflict_resolution": {
          "type": "string",
          "enum": ["highest_confidence", "majority_vote", "weighted_consensus", "reject"]
        },
        "max_iterations": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 1,
          "maximum": 1000,
          "default": 100
        }
      }
    },
    "metadata": {
      "type": "object",
      "required": ["client_id", "priority", "ttl_ms"],
      "properties": {
        "client_id": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "^CL-[0-9A-Z]{16}$"
        },
        "priority": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 0,
          "maximum": 10
        },
        "ttl_ms": {
          "type": "integer",
          "minimum": 1000,
          "maximum": 3600000
        },
        "trace_id": {
          "type": "string",
          "pattern": "^[0-9a-f]{32}$"
        },

          "type": "string",
          "maxLength": 128
        }

```

---

## 4. SRE Operational Metrics

### 4.1 Service Level Objectives (SLOs)

| Metric | Target | Error Budget (30d) | Measurement |
|--------|--------|-------------------|-------------|
| Availability | 99.95% | 21.6 min | `uptime / total_time` |
| Latency P50 | ≤ 45ms | N/A | Histogram bucket |
| Latency P99 | ≤ 200ms | 0.1% violations | Histogram bucket |
| Latency P99.9 | ≤ 500ms | 0.01% violations | Histogram bucket |
| Truth Accuracy | ≥ 98.5% | 1.5% false positives | `correct_distillations / total` |
| Throughput | ≥ 10K RPS | N/A | Sustained capacity |

### 4.2 Service Level Indicators (SLIs)

```yaml
slis:
  availability:
    formula: "sum(successful_requests) / sum(total_requests)"
    good_events: "http_status < 500 AND processing_complete = true"
    valid_events: "all_requests - health_checks"
    
  latency:
    formula: "histogram_quantile(0.99, request_duration_seconds)"
    buckets: [0.01, 0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.2, 0.5, 1.0, 2.5]
    
  correctness:
    formula: "sum(verified_truths) / sum(distillation_attempts)"
    verification_method: "cross_validation_sampling"
    sample_rate: 0.05
    
  freshness:
    formula: "time_since_last_successful_distillation < threshold"
    threshold_seconds: 60
```

### 4.3 Alerting Thresholds

```yaml
alerts:
  - name: TruthDistillHighErrorRate
    expr: |
      sum(rate(distill_errors_total[5m])) 
      / sum(rate(distill_requests_total[5m])) > 0.01
    severity: critical
    runbook: "https://runbooks.internal/td/high-error-rate"
    
  - name: TruthDistillLatencyDegraded
    expr: |
      histogram_quantile(0.99, 
        sum(rate(distill_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) by (le)
      ) > 0.2
    severity: warning
    
  - name: TruthDistillCoherenceCollapse
    expr: |
      avg(coherence_score) < 0.3 
      AND rate(distill_requests_total[1m]) > 100
    severity: critical
    
  - name: TruthDistillQuorumFailure
    expr: |
      sum(quorum_failures_total) 
      / sum(quorum_attempts_total) > 0.05
    severity: high
    
  - name: TruthDistillBPSCritical
    expr: |
      max(bps_score) by (failure_mode) >= 0.7
    severity: critical
    auto_action: circuit_breaker_engage
```

### 4.4 Operational Dashboards Metrics

```
# Core Performance
distill_requests_total{status, mode, priority}
distill_duration_seconds{quantile}
distill_source_count{bucket}
distill_iterations{bucket}

# Quality Metrics
coherence_score{request_id}
verification_weight{factor}
truth_confidence_output{bucket}
conflict_resolution_events{strategy, outcome}

# Reliability Metrics
bps_score{failure_mode}
circuit_breaker_state{component}
quorum_health{status}
source_poisoning_detected_total

# Capacity Metrics
active_distillations
queue_depth{priority}
memory_usage_bytes
cpu_utilization_ratio
```

### 4.5 Capacity Planning Formula

```
Required_Capacity = (Peak_RPS × Safety_Factor × Avg_Latency) / (1 - Target_Utilization)

Where:
  Peak_RPS = P99 of hourly request rate
  Safety_Factor = 1.5 (standard) | 2.0 (critical)
  Avg_Latency = P50 latency in seconds
  Target_Utilization = 0.7

Scaling Trigger:
  IF current_utilization > 0.65 FOR 5m THEN scale_up(ceil(current_capacity × 1.25))
  IF current_utilization < 0.35 FOR 15m THEN scale_down(floor(current_capacity × 0.8))
```

---

## 5. State Machine Definition

```
States: {INIT, COLLECTING, VALIDATING, DISTILLING, VERIFYING, COMPLETE, FAILED}

Transitions:
  INIT → COLLECTING: on(request_received) ∧ schema_valid
  INIT → FAILED: on(schema_violation)
  COLLECTING → VALIDATING: on(sources_count ≥ quorum)
  COLLECTING → FAILED: on(timeout) ∨ on(sources_count < min_sources)
  VALIDATING → DISTILLING: on(all_sources_valid)
  VALIDATING → COLLECTING: on(invalid_sources_removed) ∧ (remaining ≥ quorum)
  VALIDATING → FAILED: on(remaining < quorum)
  DISTILLING → VERIFYING: on(convergence) ∨ on(max_iterations)
  DISTILLING → FAILED: on(coherence_collapse)
  VERIFYING → COMPLETE: on(V(T) ≥ threshold)
  VERIFYING → FAILED: on(V(T) < threshold)
  
Invariants:
  ∀ state ∈ States: elapsed_time < ttl_ms
  ∀ transition: emit(metric, trace_id)
```

---

## 6. Failure Recovery Procedures

```python
# Pseudocode for recovery logic
def recovery_handler(failure_mode, context):
    match failure_mode:
        case "BPS-001":  # Source Poisoning
            quarantine_sources(context.flagged_sources)
            trigger_revalidation(context.request_id)
            emit_security_alert(severity="CRITICAL")
            
        case "BPS-002":  # Coherence Collapse
            reduce_source_set(strategy="highest_confidence_subset")
            retry_distillation(max_attempts=3)
            
        case "BPS-003":  # Verification Bypass
            engage_circuit_breaker()
            require_manual_verification()
            
        case "BPS-006":  # Cascade Propagation
            isolate_affected_components()
            initiate_graceful_degradation()
            
    log_recovery_action(failure_mode, context, outcome)
```

# A-CS-PromptSynth Technical Logic Specification

## 1. System Architecture Logic

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    A-CS-PromptSynth Core Engine                     │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  INPUT_LAYER → VALIDATION_GATE → SYNTHESIS_CORE → OUTPUT_FORMATTER  │
│       ↓              ↓                 ↓                ↓           │
│  [Raw Prompt]   [Schema Check]   [Token Analysis]  [Structured Out] │
│       ↓              ↓                 ↓                ↓           │
│  TELEMETRY ←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←←  │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## 2. Core Processing Logic

### 2.1 Prompt Decomposition Algorithm

```python
def decompose_prompt(P):
    """
    P = raw prompt string
    Returns: structured intent vector V_i
    
    Logic:
    V_i = Σ(w_k * T_k) for k in [1, n]
    where:
        w_k = semantic weight of token k
        T_k = token embedding vector
        n = total token count
    """
    
    # Complexity Score (CS)
    CS = (unique_tokens / total_tokens) * log2(total_tokens + 1)
    
    # Ambiguity Index (AI)
    AI = 1 - (explicit_constraints / total_clauses)
    
    # Synthesis Difficulty (SD)
    SD = CS * (1 + AI) * depth_factor
    
    return {
        "intent_vector": V_i,
        "complexity_score": CS,
        "ambiguity_index": AI,
        "synthesis_difficulty": SD
    }
```

### 2.2 Synthesis Core Logic

```
SYNTHESIS_FUNCTION(input_vector):
    
    1. PARSE:
       tokens[] = tokenize(input)
       intent = classify(tokens)
       
    2. VALIDATE:
       IF schema_match(input) == FALSE:
           RETURN error_state(E_SCHEMA_MISMATCH)
       IF token_count > MAX_TOKENS:
           RETURN error_state(E_TOKEN_OVERFLOW)
           
    3. TRANSFORM:
       context_window = build_context(tokens, history_depth=5)
       synthesis_output = generate(
           context_window,
           temperature=0.7,
           top_p=0.95,
           max_output_tokens=4096
       )
       
    4. VALIDATE_OUTPUT:
       coherence_score = measure_coherence(synthesis_output)
       IF coherence_score < THRESHOLD_COHERENCE:
           RETRY with adjusted_params
           
    5. RETURN structured_response
```

---

## 3. Breakdown Point Score (BPS) Matrix

### 3.1 BPS Calculation Formula

```
BPS = Σ(R_i * S_i * P_i) / N

where:
    R_i = Risk magnitude (1-10)
    S_i = Severity multiplier (1-5)
    P_i = Probability of occurrence (0.0-1.0)
    N   = Normalization factor (total risk categories)

Critical Threshold: BPS > 7.5
Warning Threshold:  BPS > 5.0
Nominal:            BPS ≤ 5.0
```

### 3.2 BPS Risk Matrix

| Failure Mode | Risk (R) | Severity (S) | Probability (P) | BPS Component | Mitigation |
|--------------|----------|--------------|-----------------|---------------|------------|
| Token Overflow | 8 | 4 | 0.15 | 4.80 | Hard limit enforcement |
| Schema Violation | 7 | 3 | 0.25 | 5.25 | Pre-validation gate |
| Context Corruption | 9 | 5 | 0.08 | 3.60 | Checksum verification |
| Synthesis Timeout | 6 | 3 | 0.20 | 3.60 | Circuit breaker pattern |
| Output Incoherence | 7 | 4 | 0.12 | 3.36 | Coherence scoring |
| Memory Exhaustion | 9 | 5 | 0.05 | 2.25 | Resource pooling |
| Cascade Failure | 10 | 5 | 0.03 | 1.50 | Bulkhead isolation |
| Rate Limit Breach | 5 | 2 | 0.30 | 3.00 | Token bucket algorithm |
| Prompt Injection | 8 | 5 | 0.10 | 4.00 | Input sanitization |
| State Desync | 7 | 4 | 0.07 | 1.96 | Idempotency keys |

### 3.3 Aggregate BPS Calculation

```
Total_BPS = (4.80 + 5.25 + 3.60 + 3.60 + 3.36 + 2.25 + 1.50 + 3.00 + 4.00 + 1.96) / 10
Total_BPS = 33.32 / 10
Total_BPS = 3.332

STATUS: NOMINAL (BPS ≤ 5.0)
```

### 3.4 BPS Escalation Logic

```
IF BPS > 7.5:
    TRIGGER incident_response(SEV1)
    ENABLE circuit_breaker(ALL_ENDPOINTS)
    NOTIFY on_call_primary
    
ELIF BPS > 5.0:
    TRIGGER alert(SEV2)
    ENABLE rate_limiting(AGGRESSIVE)
    LOG detailed_telemetry
    
ELSE:
    MAINTAIN normal_operations
    LOG standard_metrics
```

---

## 4. JSON Schema for Input Validation

# A-CS-ResonBPS Technical Specification

## 1. Core Logic Definition

### 1.1 Resonance Breakdown Point Score (BPS) Formula

```
BPS = Σ(Wᵢ × Fᵢ × Dᵢ) / (R × T)

Where:
  Wᵢ = Weight factor for failure domain i (0.0 - 1.0)
  Fᵢ = Failure frequency coefficient (events/hour)
  Dᵢ = Duration impact multiplier (minutes)
  R  = Resilience factor (0.1 - 1.0, higher = more resilient)
  T  = Time window normalization constant (60 minutes)
```

### 1.2 Composite Score Calculation

```
A-CS-ResonBPS = (BPS_infra × 0.35) + (BPS_app × 0.30) + (BPS_data × 0.25) + (BPS_network × 0.10)

Critical Threshold: A-CS-ResonBPS ≥ 0.75
Warning Threshold:  A-CS-ResonBPS ≥ 0.50
Nominal:            A-CS-ResonBPS < 0.50
```

---

## 2. BPS Matrix - Operational Failure Risks

### 2.1 Infrastructure Domain (BPS_infra)

| Risk Category | Weight (W) | Frequency Baseline (F) | Duration Multiplier (D) | Trigger Condition |
|---------------|------------|------------------------|-------------------------|-------------------|
| CPU Saturation | 0.25 | 0.15/hr | 1.5 | CPU > 85% for 5min |
| Memory Exhaustion | 0.30 | 0.08/hr | 2.0 | Memory > 90% for 3min |
| Disk I/O Bottleneck | 0.20 | 0.12/hr | 1.8 | IOPS latency > 50ms |
| Node Failure | 0.25 | 0.02/hr | 4.0 | Node unreachable > 30s |

### 2.2 Application Domain (BPS_app)

| Risk Category | Weight (W) | Frequency Baseline (F) | Duration Multiplier (D) | Trigger Condition |
|---------------|------------|------------------------|-------------------------|-------------------|
| Error Rate Spike | 0.35 | 0.20/hr | 1.2 | 5xx > 1% of requests |
| Latency Degradation | 0.25 | 0.25/hr | 1.0 | P99 > 2× baseline |
| Thread Pool Exhaustion | 0.20 | 0.10/hr | 2.5 | Active threads > 95% |
| Dependency Timeout | 0.20 | 0.18/hr | 1.8 | Upstream timeout > 5s |

### 2.3 Data Domain (BPS_data)

| Risk Category | Weight (W) | Frequency Baseline (F) | Duration Multiplier (D) | Trigger Condition |
|---------------|------------|------------------------|-------------------------|-------------------|
| Replication Lag | 0.30 | 0.05/hr | 3.0 | Lag > 30s |
| Connection Pool Saturation | 0.25 | 0.15/hr | 2.0 | Connections > 90% |
| Query Timeout | 0.25 | 0.12/hr | 1.5 | Query time > 10s |
| Data Corruption Signal | 0.20 | 0.01/hr | 5.0 | Checksum mismatch |

### 2.4 Network Domain (BPS_network)

| Risk Category | Weight (W) | Frequency Baseline (F) | Duration Multiplier (D) | Trigger Condition |
|---------------|------------|------------------------|-------------------------|-------------------|
| Packet Loss | 0.35 | 0.08/hr | 2.0 | Loss > 0.5% |
| DNS Resolution Failure | 0.25 | 0.03/hr | 3.5 | Resolution > 500ms |
| TLS Handshake Failure | 0.20 | 0.05/hr | 2.5 | Handshake timeout |
| Load Balancer Saturation | 0.20 | 0.06/hr | 2.2 | Queue depth > 1000 |

---

## 3. JSON Schema - Input Validation

```json
{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  "$id": "https://sre.internal/schemas/a-cs-resonbps/v1",
  "title": "A-CS-ResonBPS Input Schema",
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["timestamp", "source_id", "domains"],
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "timestamp": {
      "type": "string",
      "format": "date-time",
      "description": "ISO 8601 UTC timestamp"
    },
    "source_id": {
      "type": "string",

    },

      "maximum": 1.0,

    },

    },
    "domains": {
      "type": "object",

        },

      "properties": {

          "type": "string",

          "maxLength": 64
        },
        "weight": {

          "minimum": 0.0,
          "maximum": 1.0
        },
        "frequency": {
          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0.0,
          "description": "Events per hour"
        },
        "duration_multiplier": {
          "type": "number",
          "minimum": 0.1,
          "maximum": 10.0
        },
        "current_value": {
          "type": "number"
        },
        "threshold": {
          "type": "number"
        },
        "triggered": {
          "type": "boolean",
          "default": false
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

---

## 4. SRE Metrics - Operational Success Criteria

### 4.1 Service Level Indicators (SLIs)

| Metric | Formula | Target | Measurement Interval |
|--------|---------|--------|---------------------|
| BPS Calculation Latency | P99(calculation_time_ms) | ≤ 50ms | 1 minute |
| Input Validation Success Rate | valid_inputs / total_inputs × 100 | ≥ 99.9% | 5 minutes |
| Alert Delivery Latency | P95(alert_dispatch_time_ms) | ≤ 200ms | 1 minute |
| Score Accuracy | |calculated - expected| / expected | ≤ 0.01 | Per calculation |

### 4.2 Service Level Objectives (SLOs)

slos:
  availability:
    target: 99.95%
    window: 30d
    error_budget_burn_rate_alert:
      fast: 14.4  # 2% budget in 1 hour
      slow: 6.0   # 5% budget in 6 hours

  latency:
    p50_target_ms: 10
    p99_target_ms: 50
    window: 7d

    target: 99.9%

### 4.4 Alert Thresholds

alerts:
  - name: BPSCriticalThreshold
    condition: a_cs_resonbps_score_current >= 0.75
    duration: 2m
    severity: critical
    runbook: /runbooks/bps-critical

  - name: BPSWarningThreshold
    condition: a_cs_resonbps_score_current >= 0.50
    duration: 5m
    severity: warning
    runbook: /runbooks/bps-warning

  - name: BPSCalculationLatencyHigh
    condition: histogram_quantile(0.99, a_cs_resonbps_calculation_duration_seconds) > 0.05
    duration: 5m
    severity: warning

  - name: BPSErrorBudgetBurnRateFast
    condition: |
      (
        1 - (sum(rate(a_cs_resonbps_calculations_total{status="success"}[1h])) 
        / sum(rate(a_cs_resonbps_calculations_total[1h])))
      ) > (14.4 * 0.0005)
    duration: 2m
    severity: critical

  - name: BPSInputValidationDegraded
    condition: |
      sum(rate(a_cs_resonbps_validation_failures_total[5m])) 
      / sum(rate(a_cs_resonbps_calculations_total[5m])) > 0.001
    duration: 5m
    severity: warning
```

---

## 5. Calculation Engine Logic

```python
def calculate_domain_bps(metrics: list, resilience: float, time_window: int) -> float:
    """
    Calculate BPS for a single domain.
    
    Returns: float in range [0.0, ∞) - normalized score
    """
    if not metrics or resilience <= 0 or time_window <= 0:
        raise ValueError("Invalid input parameters")
    
    weighted_sum = 0.0
    for m in metrics:
        if m.triggered:
            weighted_sum += m.weight * m.frequency * m.duration_multiplier
    
    return weighted_sum / (resilience * time_window)


def calculate_composite_bps(domains: dict, weights: dict = None) -> float:
    """
    Calculate A-CS-ResonBPS composite score.
    
    Default weights:
      infrastructure: 0.35
      application: 0.30
      data: 0.25
      network: 0.10
    """
    default_weights = {
        "infrastructure": 0.35,
        "application": 0.30,
        "data": 0.25,
        "network": 0.10
    }
    
    w = weights or default_weights
    
    composite = (
        domains["infrastructure"] * w["infrastructure"] +
        domains["application"] * w["application"] +
        domains["data"] * w["data"] +
        domains["network"] * w["network"]
    )
    
    return min(composite, 1.0)  # Cap at 1.0 for normalization


def evaluate_threshold(score: float) -> str:
    """
    Evaluate score against operational thresholds.
    
    Returns: 'critical' | 'warning' | 'nominal'
    """
    if score >= 0.75:
        return "critical"
    elif score >= 0.50:
        return "warning"
    return "nominal"
```

---

## 6. State Machine - Operational States

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                                 │
│    ┌──────────┐     BPS ≥ 0.50      ┌──────────┐               │
│    │          │ ─────────────────▶  │          │               │
│    │  NOMINAL │                     │  WARNING │               │
│    │  (GREEN) │ ◀─────────────────  │ (YELLOW) │               │
│    │          │     BPS < 0.50      │          │               │
│    └──────────┘     for 5min        └──────────┘               │
│         │                                │                      │
│         │                                │ BPS ≥ 0.75           │
│         │                                ▼                      │
│         │                          ┌──────────┐                 │
│         │      BPS ≥ 0.75          │          │                 │
│         └────────────────────────▶ │ CRITICAL │                 │
│                                    │   (RED)  │                 │
│              BPS < 0.50            │          │                 │
│         ◀──────────────────────────┴──────────┘                 │
│              for 10min                                          │
│                                                                 │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

State Transition Hysteresis:
  NOMINAL → WARNING:  Immediate on threshold breach
  WARNING → CRITICAL: Immediate on threshold breach  
  CRITICAL → WARNING: Requires BPS < 0.75 for 3 minutes
  WARNING → NOMINAL:  Requires BPS < 0.50 for 5 minutes
  CRITICAL → NOMINAL: Requires BPS < 0.50 for 10 minutes
```]

# A-GAM-WorldSeed Logic Module

## Technical Documentation v2.4.1

---

## Module Overview

| Attribute | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| **Module ID** | `A-GAM-WorldSeed` |
| **Classification** | Procedural Generation Core |
| **Priority Level** | P0 - Critical Path |
| **Dependencies** | `A-GAM-NoiseGen`, `A-GAM-BiomeMapper`, `A-SYS-RNG` |

---

## Functional Description

The A-GAM-WorldSeed module serves as the deterministic initialization layer for procedural world generation. It transforms a seed integer into a reproducible pseudo-random state vector that governs terrain topology, resource distribution, and biome placement.

---

## Core Algorithms

### 1. Seed Hashing Function

**Algorithm:** Modified MurmurHash3 with avalanche mixing

```
H(s) = ((s × 0xcc9e2d51) ⊕ (s >> 16)) × 0x1b873593
```

**Time Complexity:** O(1)  
**Space Complexity:** O(1)

### 2. Octave Noise Generation

Multi-frequency Perlin noise summation:

$$
N(x, y) = \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} \frac{1}{2^i} \cdot \text{noise}\left(2^i \cdot x, 2^i \cdot y\right)
$$

Where:
- $n$ = octave count (default: 8)
- Persistence factor $p = 0.5$
- Lacunarity $\lambda = 2.0$

**Time Complexity:** O(n) per coordinate  
**Space Complexity:** O(n) for gradient cache

### 3. Chunk Generation Pipeline

$$
T_{chunk} = T_{hash} + T_{noise} \cdot k^2 + T_{biome}
$$

Where $k$ = chunk dimension (default: 16 units)

---

## Performance Specifications

### Computational Bounds

| Operation | Best Case | Average Case | Worst Case |
|-----------|-----------|--------------|------------|
| Seed Initialization | O(1) | O(1) | O(1) |
| Single Chunk Generation | O(k²) | O(k² log k) | O(k² n) |
| World Streaming (radius r) | O(r²) | O(r² log r) | O(r² n) |
| Biome Boundary Resolution | O(log b) | O(b) | O(b²) |

### Memory Footprint

| Component | Allocation |
|-----------|------------|
| Seed State Vector | 256 bytes |
| Gradient Table | 4 KB |
| Chunk Cache (LRU-64) | 16 MB |
| Biome Lookup Table | 512 KB |

---

## SRE Metrics & SLOs

### Service Level Objectives

| Metric | Target | Critical Threshold |
|--------|--------|-------------------|
| **Availability** | 99.95% | 99.9% |
| **Chunk Generation Latency (p50)** | ≤ 8 ms | ≤ 15 ms |
| **Chunk Generation Latency (p99)** | ≤ 25 ms | ≤ 50 ms |
| **Seed Collision Rate** | < 10⁻¹² | < 10⁻⁹ |
| **Determinism Verification** | 100% | 100% |

### Error Budget

$$
\text{Error Budget} = 1 - \text{SLO} = 1 - 0.9995 = 0.0005
$$

Monthly allowable downtime:

$$
T_{downtime} = 0.0005 \times 43200 \text{ min} = 21.6 \text{ min/month}
$$

---

## Failure Modes & Mitigation

### FMEA Matrix

| Failure Mode | Probability | Severity | RPN | Detection Method | Mitigation |
|--------------|-------------|----------|-----|------------------|------------|
| Seed entropy exhaustion | 0.001 | High | 72 | Entropy monitor | Secondary RNG injection |
| Chunk cache overflow | 0.01 | Medium | 48 | Memory threshold alert | LRU eviction + spillover |
| Noise coherence breakdown | 0.0001 | Critical | 90 | Checksum validation | Fallback gradient table |
| Biome boundary artifacts | 0.05 | Low | 30 | Visual regression tests | Interpolation smoothing |
| Determinism violation | 0.00001 | Critical | 95 | Hash verification | Module restart + state reload |

### Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF)

$$
\text{MTBF} = \frac{\sum T_{operational}}{N_{failures}} \geq 2160 \text{ hours}
$$

### Mean Time To Recovery (MTTR)

$$
\text{MTTR} = T_{detection} + T_{diagnosis} + T_{repair} \leq 180 \text{ seconds}
$$

---

## Monitoring & Alerting

### Key Performance Indicators

```
worldseed_chunk_generation_duration_seconds{quantile="0.99"}
worldseed_cache_hit_ratio
worldseed_seed_entropy_bits_remaining
worldseed_determinism_check_failures_total
worldseed_biome_transitions_per_chunk
```

### Alert Thresholds

| Alert | Condition | Severity |
|-------|-----------|----------|
| `WorldSeedLatencyHigh` | p99 > 50ms for 5m | Warning |
| `WorldSeedLatencyCritical` | p99 > 100ms for 2m | Critical |
| `WorldSeedEntropyLow` | bits < 128 | Critical |
| `WorldSeedCacheEvictionSpike` | rate > 100/s | Warning |

---

## Determinism Verification Protocol

Verification hash computation:

$$
V = H\left(\bigoplus_{i=0}^{n} C_i\right) \mod 2^{64}
$$

Where $C_i$ represents chunk state at index $i$.

**Verification Frequency:** Every 1000 chunks or 60 seconds  
**Tolerance:** Zero deviation permitted

---

## Version History

| Version | Date | Changes |
|---------|------|---------|
| 2.4.1 | 2024-01 | Optimized octave caching |
| 2.4.0 | 2023-11 | Added biome transition smoothing |
| 2.3.0 | 2023-08 | MTTR improvements |

---

*Documentation generated by Systems Engineering Division*  
*Classification: Internal Technical Reference*

# A-GAM-LoreReceipt Logic Module

## Technical Documentation v2.4.1

---

## Module Overview

| Attribute | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| **Module ID** | `A-GAM-LoreReceipt` |
| **Classification** | Asynchronous Game Asset Manager |
| **Domain** | Lore Content Receipt & Validation |
| **Runtime Environment** | Event-driven microservice |
| **Protocol** | gRPC / REST fallback |

---

## Functional Description

The `A-GAM-LoreReceipt` module handles ingestion, validation, deduplication, and acknowledgment of lore content payloads within the game asset pipeline. It serves as the primary receipt handler for narrative content synchronization across distributed game servers.

---

## Algorithmic Specifications

### Core Processing Algorithm

```
FUNCTION ProcessLoreReceipt(payload):
    hash ← SHA-256(payload.content)
    
    IF BloomFilter.MayContain(hash) THEN
        IF ExactMatch(hash, LoreStore) THEN
            RETURN ACK_DUPLICATE
        END IF
    END IF
    
    validated ← ValidateSchema(payload)
    IF NOT validated THEN
        RETURN NACK_INVALID
    END IF
    
    BloomFilter.Add(hash)
    LoreStore.Insert(payload, hash)
    EventBus.Publish(LORE_RECEIVED, payload.id)
    
    RETURN ACK_SUCCESS
```

### Time Complexity Analysis

| Operation | Average Case | Worst Case |
|-----------|--------------|------------|
| Hash Computation | O(n) | O(n) |
| Bloom Filter Lookup | O(k) | O(k) |
| Schema Validation | O(m) | O(m log m) |
| Store Insertion | O(1) | O(log N) |
| **Total Pipeline** | **O(n + k + m)** | **O(n + k + m log m + log N)** |

Where:
- `n` = payload content size (bytes)
- `k` = number of hash functions in Bloom filter
- `m` = schema field count
- `N` = total records in LoreStore

### Space Complexity

$$S_{total} = S_{bloom} + S_{buffer} + S_{cache}$$

$$S_{bloom} = -\frac{n \cdot \ln(p)}{(\ln 2)^2}$$

Where:
- `n` = expected number of elements
- `p` = desired false positive rate (configured: 0.01)

---

## Bloom Filter Configuration

| Parameter | Value | Formula |
|-----------|-------|---------|
| Expected Elements | 10,000,000 | — |
| False Positive Rate | 1% | $p = 0.01$ |
| Bit Array Size | 95,850,584 bits | $m = -\frac{n \ln p}{(\ln 2)^2}$ |
| Hash Functions | 7 | $k = \frac{m}{n} \ln 2$ |

---

## SRE Metrics & SLIs

### Service Level Indicators

| Metric | Target | Formula |
|--------|--------|---------|
| **Availability** | 99.95% | $\frac{uptime}{total\_time} \times 100$ |
| **Latency (p50)** | ≤ 15ms | — |
| **Latency (p99)** | ≤ 150ms | — |
| **Error Rate** | < 0.1% | $\frac{failed\_requests}{total\_requests} \times 100$ |
| **Throughput** | ≥ 10,000 RPS | — |

### Service Level Objectives

```
SLO_Availability = 99.95% over 30-day rolling window
SLO_Latency_p99 = 150ms for 99% of requests
SLO_ErrorBudget = 0.05% monthly
```

### Error Budget Calculation

$$E_{budget} = (1 - SLO_{target}) \times T_{window}$$

$$E_{remaining} = E_{budget} - E_{consumed}$$

$$BurnRate = \frac{E_{consumed}}{E_{budget}} \times \frac{T_{window}}{T_{elapsed}}$$

---

## Failure Metrics

### Failure Mode Classification

| Failure Mode | MTBF (hours) | MTTR (minutes) | Impact |
|--------------|--------------|----------------|--------|
| `FM-001` Hash Collision | 8,760 | 5 | Low |
| `FM-002` Schema Validation Timeout | 720 | 2 | Medium |
| `FM-003` Store Write Failure | 2,160 | 15 | High |
| `FM-004` Event Bus Disconnect | 1,440 | 8 | High |
| `FM-005` Memory Exhaustion | 4,320 | 20 | Critical |

### Reliability Calculations

**Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF):**
$$MTBF = \frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n} T_{operational,i}}{n_{failures}}$$

**Availability from MTBF/MTTR:**
$$A = \frac{MTBF}{MTBF + MTTR}$$

**Failure Rate (λ):**
$$\lambda = \frac{1}{MTBF} = 1.14 \times 10^{-4} \text{ failures/hour}$$

**Reliability over time t:**
$$R(t) = e^{-\lambda t}$$

---

## Circuit Breaker Configuration

```yaml
circuit_breaker:
  failure_threshold: 5
  success_threshold: 3
  timeout_ms: 30000
  half_open_requests: 3
  
states:
  CLOSED:   # Normal operation
  OPEN:     # Failing fast, no requests pass
  HALF_OPEN: # Testing recovery
```

### State Transition Logic

$$P_{trip} = \begin{cases} 1 & \text{if } failures \geq threshold \\ 0 & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}$$

---

## Retry Policy

| Attempt | Delay (ms) | Formula |
|---------|------------|---------|
| 1 | 100 | $d_0$ |
| 2 | 200 | $d_0 \times 2^1$ |
| 3 | 400 | $d_0 \times 2^2$ |
| 4 | 800 | $d_0 \times 2^3$ |
| 5 | 1600 | $d_0 \times 2^4$ |

**Exponential Backoff with Jitter:**
$$delay_n = \min(cap, base \times 2^n) + random(0, jitter)$$

---

## Monitoring & Alerting

### Key Metrics Export

```prometheus
# Request latency histogram
agam_lore_receipt_latency_seconds{quantile="0.5"}
agam_lore_receipt_latency_seconds{quantile="0.99"}

# Request counter by status
agam_lore_receipt_requests_total{status="success|duplicate|invalid|error"}

# Active connections gauge
agam_lore_receipt_active_connections

# Bloom filter saturation
agam_lore_receipt_bloom_saturation_ratio
```

### Alert Thresholds

| Alert | Condition | Severity |
|-------|-----------|----------|
| `HighErrorRate` | `error_rate > 1%` for 5m | P2 |
| `LatencyDegradation` | `p99 > 300ms` for 10m | P3 |
| `CircuitOpen` | `state == OPEN` for 2m | P1 |
| `BloomSaturation` | `saturation > 0.85` | P4 |
| `MemoryPressure` | `heap_used > 90%` | P2 |

---

## Dependencies

```
┌─────────────────────┐
│  A-GAM-LoreReceipt  │
└──────────┬──────────┘
           │
     ┌─────┴─────┬──────────────┬─────────────┐
     ▼           ▼              ▼             ▼
┌─────────┐ ┌─────────┐ ┌────────────┐ ┌───────────┐
│LoreStore│ │EventBus │ │SchemaCache │ │MetricsExp │
│ (Redis) │ │ (Kafka) │ │  (Local)   │ │(Prometheus│
└─────────┘ └─────────┘ └────────────┘ └───────────┘
```

---

## Version History

| Version | Date | Changes |
|---------|------|---------|
| 2.4.1 | 2024-01 | Added circuit breaker tuning |
| 2.4.0 | 2023-11 | Bloom filter optimization |
| 2.3.0 | 2023-08 | gRPC protocol support |

---

*Document Classification: Internal Engineering*
*Owner: Platform Infrastructure Team*
